intro: Adesmia ragonesei, commonly known as the Ragonese legume, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Brazil. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces elongated pods that contain several seeds. Adesmia ragonesei is often found in dry forests and savannas, adapting well to tropical and subtropical climates.
